info.description: This is a Phone.com api Swagger definition
info.title: Phone.com API

tags.name: calls
tags.description: This API places a call to the caller phone number (or caller extension ID). If that number (or extension) answers within the timeout period, then the callee DID (or extension) will be connected to the call. Note: This API is for users with Account Owner scope access token. Users with Extension User scope token should invoke the Calls API with the following definition: https://api.phone.com/v4/accounts/:account_id/extensions/:extension_id/calls

tags.name: oauth
tags.description: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework enables a third-party application to obtain limited access to HTTP API requests which require an access token. This page describes how to use the /oauth/authorization and /oauth/access-token API's to generate an access token.

tags.name: accounts
tags.description: This page gives an overview of how to interact with your accounts.

tags.name: applications
tags.description: Applications are references to your own software integrations that are registered to interact with your Phone.com account.

tags.name: call-logs
tags.description: The Call Logs API returns a list of call detail records for the account. The result includes the id, start time, creation time, caller ID, called number, direction of call, and duration in seconds. If applicable, the result may also include final action, final action duration, listen URL, and/or transcription. Since the call logs usually contains many calls, API users may use filters such as start_time, created_at and direction to limit the result set to calls interested. Users may also use the sorting parameters such as start_time and created_at to list result in ascending or descending order.

tags.name: devices
tags.description: Your Phone.com account may have one or more physical handsets or other VoIP devices associated with it. This service only shows generic VoIP devices at this time. If you have any physical handsets or virtualized software-based devices, you will need to continue using the Control Panel to manage them.

tags.name: listeners
tags.description: Call Event Listeners. Note: This API is for users with Account Owner scope access token. Users with Extension User scope token should invoke the Extension level Listeners API with the following definition: https://api.phone.com/v4/accounts/:account_id/extensions/:extension_id/listeners At the heart of every telephony system is the Events Engine. At Phone.com, our customers (and their call traffic) emit millions of events per day. These events play a key role in advanced integration opportunities such as CRM integration, security/auditing, and real-time contextual call control. The Listeners API Services aim to simplify and standardize the method in which events are extracted from our systems and processed. These services provide consistent interfaces for internal systems to log events, manage subscriptions, and provide interfaces for external systems (e.g. customer applications or integrations such as Salesforce CRM) to subscribe to account-specific events and manage the subscriptions. As of today, Phone.com supports the following events. More events will be added as we continue to upgrade our phone services. - call.new - call.update - call.complete - call.log - sms.in - sms.out The "call" events help customers know when a call starts, when the callee answers the call, when a call ends and when a call entry is recorded and ready for retrieval. The "sms" events help customers know when a sms is sent or received. This provides enough information for applications such as Incoming Call / SMS Notification and others to improve productivities. More events will be added once we understand more about customer needs. The Listeners service provides an interface for internal and external applications to subscribe to events. Listeners can be added by customers to their Phone.com account using the Phoenix API. A listener sets up an event type and a callback URL, when the event is emitted, it will be forwarded to the URL. For example, a call.new event may be setup with a callback URL http://newcall.phone.com, when an inbound call comes in, the event with all the call info (payload) will be forwarded to http://newcall.phone.com.

tags.name: express-service-codes
tags.description: An Express Service Code is required when a customer calls Phone.com for support. With the following services, customer may retrieve the Express Service Code associated with his/her account.

tags.name: extensions
tags.description: Your Phone.com account will have one or more extensions.

tags.name: caller-ids
tags.description: API users with Extension scope access token does not have access to the Phone Number API. This API helps user to retrieve available account phone numbers to be used as caller id via the /Calls API. Outgoing calls via the Post /calls API supports Caller ID settings. This page gives an overview on how to retrieve the list of available account phone number to be used as caller ID.

tags.name: contacts
tags.description: Each extension at Phone.com can have its own address book with any number of contacts. This page gives an overview.

tags.name: groups
tags.description: The entries in an extension's address book can be divided into any number of groups. This page gives an overview.

tags.name: media
tags.description: Note: This API is for users with Account Owner scope access token. Users with Extension User scope token should invoke the Extension level Media API with the following definition: https://api.phone.com/v4/accounts/:account_id/extensions/:extension_id/media. Your Phone.com account has two kinds of media that can be used in various ways: Hold Music and Greetings. Hold Music can be used in routes, queues, and anywhere the caller might be placed on hold. Your account has access to a set of standard hold music options, and optionally another set of premium hold music options. You can also upload your own hold music, subject to copyright limitations. Greetings are verbal messages that can be played in various places to provide the caller with important information. For example, greetings are used when a caller first enters a menu or if they enter an invalid option. You also might use a greeting to alert the user to the fact that their call is being recorded.

tags.name: menus
tags.description: We've all been on the consuming side of a phone menu before. You call a company and hear, "Press '1' for Sales. Press '2' for Support. Press '0' for the operator." With Phone.com you can create your own menus!

tags.name: oauth-clients
tags.description: Phone.com API supports OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework, which enables a third-party application (client) to obtain limited access to HTTP API requests. This page describes how to use the /oauth/clients API to list, get and delete client.

tags.name: oauth-clients-redirect-uris
tags.description: The Account OAuth Clients API supports redirect-uri. Since an OAuth Client is created by a Phone.com admin who does not know what redirect uris should be assigned, API users may use the OAuth Client Redirect URIs API to create, list, get and delete redirect uris.

tags.name: payment-methods
tags.description: Phone.com accepts credit card payment, and the Account Payment Methods API allows users to add, list, get, update and delete a credit card payment method.

tags.name: phone-numbers
tags.description: Your Phone.com account has one or more phone numbers registered to it.

tags.name: queues
tags.description: Queues are used when you want to direct calls to a pool of phone numbers and/or extensions. A common utilization of queues is for Customer Service call centers. When a queue is configured on your phone number, Phone.com will route incoming calls to members of the queue. If a queue member is already on another call, our service rings the next phone number or extension in the queue. While your callers are waiting to be connected, you can choose to play Hold Music.

tags.name: routes
tags.description: Routes, a.k.a. "Call Handling Rules" or "Presets", are used to tell Phone.com how to handle incoming phone calls. They can be used to connect your Phone.com phone number to an extension, a menu, a calling queue, or many other things. The fundamental element of a route is an action. We support many different actions such as forward, menu, and voicemail. See below for the full details. In general, actions are processed one at a time in the order you specify, until the call is answered or disconnected. Answering or disconnecting stops any additional actions from being performed. Note that several actions such as voicemail, menu, and fax completely take over processing the call and do not result in processing any subsequent actions. Actions are grouped into rule sets. Rule sets can be filtered based on the time of day or the caller's phone number. When processing an incoming call, Phone.com's routing engine will evaluate each rule set in the order that was specified when the route was created or updated. The first matching rule set will be used, and all other rule sets will be ignored. Each route must have at least one unfiltered rule set. Note that if your route contains multiple unfiltered rule sets, only the first one will be used.

tags.name: schedules
tags.description: Schedules are used at various places in your Phone.com account. A schedule can specify a recurring weekly pattern such as "Monday through Friday" or a single time period such as "Thanksgiving Weekend 2015".

tags.name: sms
tags.description: The Phone.com /sms service lets you send and show history of SMS messages. Note: This API is for users with Account Owner scope access token. Users with Extension User scope token should invoke the Extension level SMS API with the following definition: https://api.phone.com/v4/accounts/:account_id/extensions/:extension_id/sms. Phone.com’s standard phone service lets you send and receive SMS messages using your Phone.com numbers. The Phone.com API extends this functionality, letting you send SMS messages from your application (through your phone number and our API server) to your users. You can also use the API to retrieve the history of sms sent from / delivered to your account.

tags.name: subaccounts
tags.description: This page gives an overview of how to interact with your subaccounts. Subaccounts are the same as master accounts in terms of the functionality Phone.com supports. The main difference is that subaccounts are grouped with their master account for invoicing purposes.

tags.name: pricing
tags.description: This page gives an overview of how a Phone.com Master Account manages its pricing plan (coupon code) for its Subaccounts. API Token with Billing Scope: Your Phone.com account API token must have Billing Scope enabled in order to use any of our pricing services. Please contact Support if you need this.

tags.name: trunks
tags.description: SIP Trunks are used to connect your Phone.com account to your PBX. SIP Trunking Customers Only: Your Phone.com account must have SIP Trunking enabled in order to use any of our trunking features. Please contact Support if you need this. Otherwise, all requests to these services will result in a 403 Forbidden error.

tags.name: voicemail
tags.description: Phone.com’s standard phone service allows callers leave voicemail if the incoming call was not answered. The /voicemail services show history of voicemail and allow users download voicemail for offline playback. Note: This API is for users with Account Owner scope access token. Users with Extension User scope token should invoke the Voicemail API with the following definition: https://api.phone.com/v4/accounts/:account_id/extensions/:extension_id/voicemail

tags.name: available-numbers
tags.description: This service lists phone numbers that are available for purchase through Phone.com.

tags.name: number-regions
tags.description: This service shows the quantities of phone numbers available for purchase, using region-based grouping.

get.summary: The default API command
get.description: The default API command

get.summary: Retrieve details of an access token, such as scope, expiration and extension ID.
get.description: Retrieve details of an access token, such as scope, expiration and extension ID. Voip ID will be returned as well if scope contains account-owner scope.

post.summary: To create an access token via the /oauth/access-token API, an API user may choose any one of the grant types it supports: Authorization Code Grant, Client Credential Grant, Password Credential Grant or Refresh Token Grant.
post.description: To create an access token via the /oauth/access-token API, an API user may choose any one of the grant types it supports: Authorization Code Grant, Client Credential Grant, Password Credential Grant or Refresh Token Grant. For Authorization Code Grant, the input parameter 'code' is generated via the Create Authorization API. NOTE: The Create Access Token API now accepts requests in query string format as well as JSON body format. See OAuth for more details on how to obtain client id and client secret to create an access token at real time.

get.summary: Create Authorization Code or Access Token.
get.description: Create Authorization Code or Access Token. The /oauth/authorization API supports Authorization Grant and Implicit Grant. In Authorization Grant, this API returns a code (response_type=code) for clients implemented in a browser using a scripting language such as JavaScript. Users may then use the code via the Create Access Token API to create an access token. The Implicit Grant is a simplified authorization code flow. In the implicit flow, instead of issuing the client an authorization code, the client is issued an access token (response_type=token) directly. See OAuth for more details on how to obtain client id and client secret to create authorization code access token at real time.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: 'token' for Implicit Grant; 'code' for Authorization Code Grant

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: account-owner, extension-user and/or methods:ALL, separated by space (%20)

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The URL where the response data of this API is redirected to

get.description: This service lists the quantities of available phone numbers by region.

parameters.name: group_by
parameters.description: Fields to group by (supports the same set of fields as the filters and sorting)

filterCreatedAtSmsVoicemail.name: filters[created_at]
filterCreatedAtSmsVoicemail.description: Date string representing the UTC time that sms was created

filterDirectionCallLogs.name: filters[direction]
filterDirectionCallLogs.description: Call direction filter: in or out

filterTo.name: filters[to]
filterTo.description: Callee ID filter, the E.164 phone number to send the SMS TO. Note you must encode the + as %2B

filterNxx.name: filters[nxx]
filterNxx.description: 2nd set of 3 digits filter (North America only)

sortStartTime.name: sort[start_time]
sortStartTime.description: Sorting by call start time: asc or desc

sortCreatedAtCallLogs.name: sort[created_at]
sortCreatedAtCallLogs.description: Sorting by call log creation time: asc or desc

sortCreatedAtSms.name: sort[created_at]
sortCreatedAtSms.description: Sort by created time of message

sortCreatedAtVoicemail.name: sort[created_at]
sortCreatedAtVoicemail.description: Sort by the UTC time that voicemail was created

code.description: Authorization Code created via the /oauth/authorization API

redirect_uri.description: The redirect URI where user enters authentication information

scope.description: account-owner, extension-user and/or methods:ALL, separated by space (%20)

caller_phone_number.description: Caller phone number in E.164 format

caller_caller_id.description: Caller caller ID in E.164 format

caller_private.description: Flag to set caller ID to private

callee_phone_number.description: Callee phone number in E.164 format

callee_caller_id.description: Callee caller ID in E.164 format

callee_private.description: Flag to set callee ID to private

url.description: URL of webhook, where the event is emitted to. Note: The listener supports both HTTP & HTTPS, we highly recommend that users use HTTPS on all callbacks (with user name and password) to ensure no one may send malicious events pretending to be Phone.com.

role.description: Role of callback: main or backup

username.description: Optional user name needed to logon to the webhook URL

password.description: Optional password needed to logon to the webhook URL

timeout.description: Optional : Duration of HTTP response will time out while sending the event to the callback URL. (1 - 10 seconds)

route.description: Route object lookup (must belong to this extension)

tts_text.description: Text used for text-to-speech conversion, maximum 800 characters

is_temparary.description: 'Y', 'N'. Media file is temporary, will be deleted after a specified period.

expiration_date.description: If is_temporary is 'Y', media will be deleted after the specified time in seconds

randomized.description: 'Y', 'N'. Start playing the media file in random location, instead of from the beginning

cc_token.description: Credit Card Token. Token is obtained by entering credit card info via the Credit Card Entry Form

redirect_uri.description: Redirect URI string for use in redirect-based flows such as the authorization code and implicit flows

extension.description: Required if type = "extension". Extension that messages should be directed to. Output is an Extension Summary Object. Input must be an Extension Lookup Object.

application.description: Required if type = "application". Application that messages should be directed to. Output is an Application Summary Object. Input must be an Application Lookup Object.

ring_time.description: Number of seconds to ring each member

text.description: Text body of the outgoing SMS message. Maximum 160 characters per message.

extension_id.description: ID of Extension where the sms is saved

contact.description: Contact Object. See below for details.

billing_contact.description: Contact Object for billing purposes. See below for details.

reason.description: Reason this pricing plan is added to the subaccount

expire_date.description: Pricing plan expiration time in UNIX format. Disregard or set it to null for plan which never expires

uri.description: URI of Trunk (in the form of SIP/user@host.com:port)

items.description: Array of Contact Phone Number Objects. See below for details.

type.description: Type of phone number, must be one of: home, business, mobile, fax, pager. Default is home.

number.description: Phone number, as entered. Does not need to be formatted in any particular way. Required.

normalized.description: Phone number in E.164 format. Read-only.

AccountFull.description: The Full Account Object includes all of the properties in the Account Summary Object, along with the following:

id.description: Account ID. Sometimes referred to as "Voip ID" or "voip_id".

password.description: Account password. For security reason, this is masked as "**"

master_account.description: If this account is a subaccount, this property shows the master account that it belongs to. Otherwise it is NULL. Read-only. Output is an Account Summary Object.

contact.description: Contact Object. See below for details.

billing_contact.description: Contact Object for billing purposes. See below for details.

AccountSummary.description: The Account Summary Object is used to briefly represent an account. It can occur in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

id.description: Account ID. Sometimes referred to as "Voip ID" or "voip_id".

PricingFull.description: The Full Pricing Object is identical to the Pricing Summary Object. The Pricing Summary Object is used to briefly represent a pricing plan. Here are the properties:

reason.description: Reason this pricing plan is applied

who.description: Name of the person / process who added this pricing plan to the subaccount

expire_date.description: Pricing plan expiration timestamp in unix format. If pricing plan never expires, this item will not be returned

Address.description: Contact Address Object. See below for details.

province.description: Province. Required if country is US

ApplicationFull.description: The Full Application Object is identical to the Application Summary Object. See above for details.

ApplicationSummary.description: The Application Summary Object is used to briefly represent an application. It can occur in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

CallLogFull.description: The Full Call Log Object includes the properties in the Call Log Summary Object, along with the following:

uuid.description: Internal system id, may be null

caller_id.description: Call made from this phone number

called_number.description: Call made to this phone number

created_at.description: Call log creation time. Same as call end time + time needed to create call log

voicemail_url.description: URL of voicemail if available. User may download the audio via this URL. Empty string if voicemail does not exist

voicemail_cp_url.description: URL of voicemail if available. User may listen to the audio online via this URL. Empty string if voicemail does not exist

voicemail_transcript.description: Transcript of voicemail if enabled and available

call_recording_url.description: URL of call recording if available. User may download the audio via this URL. Empty string if call recording does not exist

call_recording_cp_url.description: URL of call recording if available. User may listen to the audio online via this URL. Empty string if call recording does not exist

details.description: A list of call flows from beginning of call to end of call.

CallDetails.description: Each item in the 'details' record may contain the following properties:

start_time.description: UNIX time stamp representing the UTC time that this call item starts

type.description: Endpoint for this call item, such as call, voicemail, fax, menu, menu item, queue ...

id_value.description: ID associated with this call item endpoint (type)

DeviceFull.description: The Full Device Object includes the properties in the Device Summary Object, along with the following:

lines.description: Array of Line Objects showing which extensions are attached to this device, and their assigned line numbers. See below for details.

SipAuthentication.description: A SIP Authentication Properties Object. See below for details. Read-only.

username.description: Username. This is the ID of the device.

extension.description: Extensions object that this line number is mapped to.

DeviceSummary.description: The Device Summary Object is used to briefly represent a VoIP device. It consists of the ID and name only:

ListenerFull.description: The Listener Object is used to represent a listener. Here are the properties:

event_type.description: Type of event subscribed by the listener: call.new, call.update, call.complete, call.log, sms.in, sms.out

ExpressServiceCodeFull.description: The Full Express Service Code Object includes the properties in the Express Service Code Summary Object, along with the following:

expire_date.description: UNIX time stamp representing the UTC time that the Express Service Code expires. Please note that every time this service is executed, the expire_date is set to now + 24 hours.

ExtensionFull.description: The Full Extension Object has the same properties as the Extension Summary Object, along with the following:

id.description: ID of the extension. This is the internal Phone.com ID, not the extension number callers may dial.

name.description: User-supplied name for the extension. On POST, leaving this empty will result in an auto-generated value. On PUT, this field is required.

extension.description: Extension number that callers may dial. On POST, leaving this empty will result in an auto-generated value. On PUT, this field is required.

voip_id.description: API Account ID. Optional, object may return the voip_id.

full_name.description: Full name of the individual or department to which this extension is assigned

usage_type.description: Can be "limited" or "unlimited". In most cases, changing this will affect your monthly bill. Please see our Control Panel or contact Customer Service for pricing.

timezone.description: Time zone. Can be in any commonly recognized format, such as "America/Los_Angeles".

name_greeting.description: Greeting that communicates the extension's name. Output is a Greeting Summary Object. Input must be a Greeting Lookup Object.

include_in_directory.description: Whether this extension should be included in the dial-by-name directory for this account. Boolean.

caller_id.description: Phone number to use as Caller ID for outgoing calls. Must be a phone number belonging to this account, or one of any additional authorized phone numbers. You can use our List Caller Ids service to see a current list. To unassign, you may set this to "private", NULL, or an empty string.

local_area_code.description: For outbound calls, this is the North American area code that this extension is calling from.

enable_call_waiting.description: Whether Call Waiting is enabled. Boolean. Default is TRUE.

enable_outbound_calls.description: Whether outgoing calls are enabled. Boolean. Default is TRUE.

route.description: Route which will handle incoming voice and fax calls. Only valid on PUT requests, not POST. Output is a Route Summary Object if the route is named, otherwise the Full Route Object will be shown. Input must be a Route Lookup Object pointing to a named route. Route must belong to this extension already.

DeviceMembership.description: Device Membership Object, or NULL. Read-only. See below for details.

line.description: Line number to which this extension is assigned. Integer.

device.description: Device that this extension belongs to. Output is an Device Summary Object.

Voicemail.description: Voicemail Object. See below for details.

password.description: Password for accessing voicemail box. Must be digits only.

attachments.description: If notification emails are being used, this defines the format of the audio attachments. Can be "wav" for WAV format, "mp3" for MP3 format, or NULL to disable attachments.

notifications.description: Voicemail Notifications Object. See below for details. Can be set to NULL to disable notifications.

transcription.description: Type of voicemail transcription to use. Can be "human" for high-quality manual transcriptions by human operators, "automated" for machine-generated transcriptions, or NULL to omit trancriptions. Changing this option will affect your monthly bill. Please see our Control Panel or contact Customer Service for details.

Greeting.description: Voicemail Greeting Object. See below for details. Can be set to NULL to reset greeting options.

type.description: The greeting to play. Can be "name" for the name_greeting as described above, "standard" for the standard greeting, or "alternate" for an alternate greeting. See below for details.

alternate.description: Greeting to be played when type="alternate". Output is a Greeting Summary Object. Input must be a Greeting Lookup Object.

standard.description: Greeting to be played when type="standard". Output is a Greeting Summary Object. Input must be a Greeting Lookup Object.

enable_leave_message_prompt.description: Whether to prompt the caller with the following words after the voicemail greeting has been played: "Please leave your message after the tone. When finished, hang up or press the pound key." Boolean.

Notification.description: The Call Notifications object configures the recipient(s) of notifications when calls are received to this extension.

sms.description: Phone number capable of receiving SMS messages

ExtensionSummary.description: The Extension Summary Object is used to briefly represent an extension. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

id.description: ID of the extension. This is the internal Phone.com ID, not the extension number callers may dial.

name.description: User-supplied name for the extension. On POST, leaving this empty will result in an auto-generated value. On PUT, this field is required.

extension.description: Extension number that callers may dial. On POST, leaving this empty will result in an auto-generated value. On PUT, this field is required.

CallerIdFull.description: Here are all of the properties you can expect for Caller ID objects:

name.description: Name you have supplied for this number

type.description: Type of Caller ID. account means this number is registered to your account, and extra refers to extra numbers which you have authorized, which are not managed under Phone.com.

ContactFull.description: The Full Contact Object includes all of the properties in the Contact Summary Object, along with several more:

prefix.description: Salutation, such as Mr, Mrs, or Dr

nickname.description: Nickname, or a shortened informal version of the contact's name

phonetic_first_name.description: Phonetic first name. Useful for remembering how to pronounce the contact's name.

phonetic_middle_name.description: Phonetic middle name. Useful for remembering how to pronounce the contact's name.

phonetic_last_name.description: Phonetic last name. Useful for remembering how to pronounce the contact's name.

emails.description: Array of Contact Email Objects. See below for details.

phone_numbers.description: Array of Contact Phone Number Objects. See below for details.

addresses.description: Array of Contact Address Objects. See below for details.

created_at.description: Integer UNIX timestamp when the contact was created. Read-only.

updated_at.description: Integer UNIX timestamp when the contact was created. Read-only.

type.description: Email type, one of: primary or alternate. Default is primary.
Address type, one of: home or business. Default is home.

street.description: House number and street name, including apartment, suite, etc.

GroupListContacts.description: Contact Group that this contact is filed under. Output is a Group Summary Object. Input is a Group Lookup Object.

ContactSummary.description: The Contact Summary Object is used to briefly represent a contact from your address book. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

prefix.description: Salutation, such as Mr, Mrs, or Dr

nickname.description: Nickname, or a shortened informal version of the contact's name

GroupFull.description: The Full Group Object is identical to the Group Summary Object. See above for details.

GroupSummary.description: The Group Summary Object is used to briefly represent a contact group. It can occur in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

MediaFull.description: The Full Recording Object and the Summary Recording Object are the same.

type.description: Can be hold_music or greeting. Indicates the purpose of this recording and where it can be used.

MediaSummary.description: The Recording Summary Object is used to briefly represent a media recording. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

MenuFull.description: The Full Menu Object contains the same properties as the Menu Summary Object, along with the following:

allow_extension_dial.description: Boolean. Determines whether a caller can enter an extension number to bypass the menu.

keypress_wait_time.description: Number of seconds to wait for the caller to choose a menu option. Must be between 1 and 5 seconds.

greeting.description: Greeting that is played when a caller enters a menu. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to FALSE.

keypress_error.description: Message that is played when the caller makes a keypress error. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to FALSE.

timeout_handler.description: Route that will be entered when the caller fails to choose a menu option within the allotted time. Output is a Route Summary Object if the route is named, otherwise the Full Route Object will be shown. Input must be a Route Lookup Object pointing to a named route.

options.description: Array of menu option objects. See below for details.

MenuSummary.description: The Menu Summary Object is used to briefly represent a menu. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

key.description: Keypad key. Must equal a single digit or the pound sign ("#").

route.description: Route which will be entered when the user presses the designated key. Output is a Route Summary Object if the route is named, otherwise the Full Route Object will be shown. Input must be a Route Lookup Object pointing to a named route.

OauthClientFull.description: An OAuth Client Full Object is identical as a Summary Object.

uri.description: The Uniform Resource Identifier is a string used to identify the path to be redirected

OauthClientRedirectUriFull.description: An OAuth Client Full Object is identical as a Summary Object.

PaymentSummary.description: The Payment Method Summary Object is used to briefly represent a Credit Card. It consists of parameters in the table below:

status.description: 'primary' = primary card used for billing; 'onfile' = card on file; 'hidden' = deleted card;

PaymentFull.description: The Payment Method Full Object contains the same properties as the Payment Method Summary Object, along with the following:

status.description: 'primary' = primary card used for billing; 'onfile' = card on file; 'hidden' = deleted card;

decline_count.description: Number of times the payment method was declined

updated_at.description: Last time the payment method was updated

cc_token.description: Encrypted credit card token to be used for billing

cc_number.description: Credit card number partially masked with xxxxxxxx

PhoneNumberFull.description: The Full Phone Number Object has all of the properties of the Phone Number Summary Object, along with several more, as shown below:

id.description: Integer Phone number ID. This is the internal Phone.com ID for this number, not the phone number itself. Read-only.

block_incoming.description: Whether to block incoming calls. Boolean.

block_anonymous.description: Whether to block anonymous calls. Boolean.

route.description: The Route assigned to handle incoming calls for this number, if any. Output is a Route Summary Object, or NULL if not set. Input can be a Route Lookup Object or NULL to unset.

CallerIdPhoneNumber.description: Here are all of the properties you can expect for Caller ID objects:

name.description: Name that this number will be associated with. Must be no longer than 15 characters, and can only contain English letters, numbers, spaces, and commas.

extension.description: Required if type = "extension". Extension that messages should be directed to. Output is an Extension Summary Object. Input must be an Extension Lookup Object.

application.description: Required if type = "application". Application that messages should be directed to. Output is an Application Summary Object. Input must be an Application Lookup Object.

sms.description: A phone number capable of receiving SMS messages

QueueFull.description: The Full QueueObject has the same properties as the Queue Summary Object, along with the following:

greeting.description: Greeting to be played when caller first connects. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to FALSE. Can be set to NULL to disable the greeting.

max_hold_time.description: Maximum hold time in seconds. If provided, must equal one of: 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, 600, 900, 1200, 1800, 2700, 3600. Default is 300.

caller_id_type.description: Caller id type to show members. If provided, must equal one of: 'called_number', 'calling_number'. Default is 'calling_number'.

ring_time.description: Number of seconds to ring a member before cycling to the next member. If provided, must equal one of: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30. Default is 5.

members.description: Array of Member Objects. Non-virtual account extensions or phone numbers. See below for details.

QueueSummary.description: The Queue Summary Object is used to briefly represent a calling queue. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

HoldMusic.description: Hold Music to be played while callers are waiting. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to TRUE. Default is to play a standard ring tone.

extension.description: Extension that this member refers to. Output is an Extension Summary Object. Input must be an Extension Lookup Object.

RouteFull.description: The root level of the Full Route Object includes all of the properties in the Route Summary Object, along with two more:

extension.description: Extension to which this route belongs. Output is an Extension Summary Object. Input must be an Extension Lookup Object. Optional. Cannot be changed after a route is created.

rules.description: Array of Rule Set Objects. Required. See below for details. When processing incoming calls, the first matching rule set will be used, and all others will be ignored.

actions.description: Array of Action Objects. Required. Routes have rule sets, and rule sets have one or more actions. The supported actions are described below:

RuleSetFilter.description: Filter Object. Optional. See below for details.

schedule.description: Schedule that this filter refers to. Output is a Schedule Summary Object. Input must be a Schedule Lookup Object. Required.

contact.description: Address Book Contact that this filter refers to. Output is a Contact Summary Object. Input must be a Contact Lookup Object. Required.

group.description: Address Book Group that this filter refers to. Output is a Contact Group Summary Object. Input must be a Contact Group Lookup Object. Required.

RuleSetAction.description: Filter Object. Optional. See below for details.

extension.description: Extension that this action refers to. Output is an Extension Summary Object. Input must be an Extension Lookup Object. Required.

items.description: This action is for forwarding calls to any number of extensions or phone numbers. The forwarding is handled in parallel, meaning that all phone numbers and/or extensions will ring simultaneously. When the call is answered by any single phone number or extension, ringing will stop for all of them. Subsequent actions in this rule set will be performed if the call is not answered before the timeout period is reached, or if it is forwarded to an extension that has its own route and that route does not result in any actions that disconnect the call or take over call handling.

timeout.description: Seconds that our routing engine should wait until moving on. Optional. Must be an integer between 5 and 90. Default is 5 seconds.

hold_music.description: Hold Music to be played while callers are waiting. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Optional. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to TRUE. Default is to play a standard ring tone.

greeting.description: Greeting that this action refers to. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Required. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to FALSE.

duration.description: Required. Seconds that the caller should be placed on hold before being moved onto the next action. Must be an integer between 1 and 60 seconds.

menu.description: Menu that this action refers to. Required. Output is a Menu Summary Object. Input must be a Menu Lookup Object.

queue.description: Queue that this action refers to. Required. Output is a Queue Summary Object. Input must be a Queue Lookup Object.

trunk.description: Trunk that this action refers to. Required. Output is a Trunk Summary Object. Input must be a Trunk Lookup Object.

RuleSetForwardItem.description: Array of Forward Item Objects. See below for details. Required.

type.description: Required. Must equal phone_number or extension.

extension.description: Required if type = "extension". Extension that callers should be directed to. Output is an Extension Summary Object. Input must be an Extension Lookup Object.

number.description: Required if type = "phone_number". Phone number that callers should be directed to. Must be a string in E.164 format.

screening.description: Boolean. Optional. Default is FALSE. Use this to activate call screening. If TRUE, the timeout on the parent action should be at least 30 seconds.

caller_id.description: Optional. Must equal calling_number or called_number. Defines which phone number should be used for Caller ID. Default is calling_number.

voice_tag.description: Optional string. If screening = TRUE, this value will be passed into our Text-To-Speech engine and used to inform the caller of who they have reached.

distinctive_ring.description: Optional. Must equal one of: DEFAULT, STYLE_2, STYLE_3, STYLE_4, STYLE_5, STYLE_6, STYLE_7, STYLE_8, or STYLE_9. Identifies the style of ring tone you will hear when an incoming call is waiting.

RouteSummary.description: The Route Summary Object is used to briefly represent a route. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

ScheduleFull.description: The Full Schedule Object is identical to the Schedule Summary Object. See above for details.

ScheduleSummary.description: The Schedule Summary Object is used to briefly represent a schedule. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

SmsFull.description: The Full SMS Object includes all of the properties in the SMS Summary Object.

from.description: Caller ID number to display on the incoming/outgoing SMS message. For an outgoing message, it must be a phone number associated with your Phone.com account.

direction.description: Direction of SMS. 'in' for Incoming messages, 'out' for Outgoing messages.

created_epoch.description: Unix time stamp representing the UTC time that the object was created in the Phone.com API system.

created_at.description: Date string representing the UTC time that the object was created in the Phone.com API system.

is_new.description: True when SMS is new; False when SMS has been read.

number.description: Phone number that will receive the SMS message

status.description: Indicate the status of your SMS object. May be 'sent', 'received', 'queued', 'new' ...

TrunkFull.description: The Full Trunk Object is identical to the Trunk Summary Object, along with the following:

max_minutes_per_month.description: Max minutes per month. Default is 750.

greeting.description: Greeting. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to FALSE.

error_message.description: Error Message. Output is a Media Summary Object. Input must be a Media Lookup Object. Must refer to a media recording that has is_hold_music set to FALSE.

codecs.description: Custom audio codec configuration, if any is needed. If provided, must be a simple array containing the prioritized list of desired codecs. Supported codecs are: g711u 64k, g711u 56k, g711a 64k, g711a 56k, g7231, g728, g729, g729A, g729B, g729AB, gms full, rfc2833, t38, ilbc, h263, g722, g722_1, g729D, g729E, amr, amr_wb, efr, evrc, h264, mpeg4, red, cng, SIP Info to 2833

TrunkSummary.description: The Trunk Summary Object is used to briefly represent a trunk. It can be seen in several places throughout this API. Here are the properties:

VoicemailFull.description: The Full Voicemail Object includes all of the properties in the Voicemail Summary Object.

extension.description: Extension where the voicemail is saved into.

to.description: The phone number where the caller is calling

is_new.description: True when Voicemail is new; False when Voicemail has been listened

created_at.description: Date string representing the UTC time that the object was created in the Phone.com API system.

folder.description: Folder name where voicemail is saved

FromObject.description: Each entry in a Voicemail's from list is an object with the following properties:

name.description: The name / caller ID of the caller

city.description: The city where the caller is from

state.description: The state where the caller is from

AvailableNumbersFull.description: The Full Available Phone Number Object includes the properties in the Summary Object, along with the following:

formatted.description: Human-readable formatted version of the phone number

price.description: The one-time initial price for this number, in USD. Some numbers show REQUEST_QUOTE here. Please contact our sales department if you are interested in these numbers.

country_code.description: The international dialing prefix for this number. For US and Canadian numbers, for example, this will be "1".

npa.description: Area code (a.k.a. NPA). Included for North American numbers only.

nxx.description: Second 3 digits (a.k.a. NXX). Included for North American numbers only.

xxxx.description: Last 4 digits (a.k.a. XXXX). Included for North American numbers only.

city.description: City with which this number is associated, if known. Otherwise NULL.

province.description: State or Province with which this number is associated, if known. Postal Code. Otherwise NULL.

country.description: Country with which this number is associated, if known. Otherwise NULL.

PhoneNumbersRegionFull.description: The Region Object may include any of several fields describing the group, as well as the quantity of phone numbers available in that group. Here are the properties:

country_code.description: Optional. Integer representing the international calling code for the phone number's country.

npa.description: Optional. Area Code, for North American phone numbers.

nxx.description: Optional. Second set of 3 digits, for North American phone numbers.

is_toll_free.description: Optional. Boolean describing whether the phone numbers in this group are toll free.

province_postal_code.description: Optional. Two-letter postal code for the state or province.

country_postal_code.description: Optional. Two-letter postal code for the country.

quantity.description: Integer. Quantity of phone numbers currently available in the given region.
